intro: Corydalis solida var. digitata, commonly known as the digitate corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early spring blooms and unique floral structure.
